data.title: Context Network
data.text:
Sarah Beth Aubrey’s mission is to enhance success and profitability in agriculture and rural communities by building capacity in people. She believes everyone has a unique definition of success and strives to foster that potential whether through one-on-one executive coaching, by facilitating peer groups, or by leading boards through change-based planning initiatives. An entrepreneur since 2003, in 2015 she founded A.C.T., Aubrey Coaching & Training, a performance-based leadership training and executive coaching firm. In January 2018 she launched Elevate Ag, a farmer and agribusiness CEO peer group network program. Sarah began her career with Novartis moving next into business development and training with ABG, Inc. Entrepreneurial at heart, at 26 she launched a retail meat business and at 30 a grant writing firm. Both businesses have been sold to investors. As the former CEO of Prosperity Ag, LLC, She wrote over 300 successful grants, in 39 states, yielding nearly $60 million. A partial list of clients includes: Nutrien/Crop Production Services, Valent USA, American Feed Industry Association, the National Sorghum Association, Indiana Farm Bureau, the State of Indiana, Brock Grain Handling, Purdue University, Wabash Valley Power Company, Farm Journal Media, Vectren, Virginia’s Ag Region 2000, NTCA The Rural Broadband Association, and Beck Ag, CornProTrailers, and Bayer Crop Science.

Education & Certification

•BS, Agricultural Communications – University of Illinois

•MS, Strategic Communication – Purdue University

Bo has a diverse set of talents within agriculture, business, and technology. He works with agricultural leaders to understand their most pressing issues and provides strategic insights to help pave a more resilient agriculture industry. He supports The Context Network by synthesizing both quantitative and qualitative data to draw insights towards a desired outcome. Bo excels in developing frameworks to enable the deep and broad expertise found at The Context Network. He provides business/market analysis and supports clients to meet their goals.

Formerly, the V.P. US Pork Business at Zoetis and has served in marketing, sales, and leadership roles in Animal Health for 30 years. She is a seasoned executive who has a history of successfully leading dynamic organizations to drive performance and a unique ability to lead teams and develop people. It is her keen understanding of business processes, strength in building teams, and ability to instill dedication to team success that has made her an effective and proven leader. Gloria has designed and delivered a wide range of business solutions to improve results by enhancing individual and organizational capability through innovation and creativity. She is a strong collaborator, energetic problem-solver and dynamic facilitator, who employs outcomes-based design to improve the performance of teams and workgroups. She is known for identifying strategic opportunities that have radically changed the market and positively transformed business models.

Jim has nearly four decades of leadership experience in the global agriculture and food sector. In 2016, Jim retired from DuPont as executive vice president and a member of the company's Office of the Chief Executive. In his final role at DuPont, he had responsibility for DuPont Pioneer, Crop Protection and Nutrition & Health businesses as well as the corporate functions of: Sustainability; Safety, Health & Environment; Product Stewardship & Regulatory; and Government Affairs as well as the Latin America Region. Mr. Borel joined DuPont in 1978 as a sales representative in the agricultural products business. Over his career, he held a variety of progressively responsible roles in product, sales and business management, as well as human resources and manufacturing roles in Agricultural Products and corporately in the US, United Kingdom, Canada and Japan.

Mike Borel is a business visionary and take-charge executive who brings success in improving competitive position, increasing sales and profit, and enhancing stockholder value. He has revitalized, streamlined and turned around organizations to generate positive cash flow, increase market share, improve productivity and reduce costs. During his executive career, Mike has applied common sense and business skills to lead teams in outperforming competitors in sales and profits in every position he has held, including President & COO Valent; Chairman & CEO Novazone; Business Manager Europe, Middle East, Africa, DuPont; and General Manager Australasia, DuPont. Mike is now enabling extraordinary results for other companies as a consultant by helping identify and implement winning strategy and enabling critical decisions.

Amanda Bushell has worked at the intersection of business, science and policy in the food system for eight years. She has a passion for technologies and strategies that allow for more efficiency and longevity in natural resource management. She has experience in aquaculture, insect-based protein, fisheries management, international policy and food waste reduction. She resides in Washington, DC with her husband.Herroles and experiences include:

Consultant at the World Bank on the global fisheries partnership

MBA Intern at Walmart in Global Food Sourcing

Co-founder of the North American Coalition for Insect Agriculture and former director of feed

Program Assistant at the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History in the office of ocean science

Donald Coles has over 40 years of business experience in agriculture with particular expertise in the seed industry, food retailing and sustainability solutions for food supply chains. As President of the International Seed Federation Donald represented the global seed industry in interactions with the UN and FAO. During his career Donald initiated supply chain efficiencies that resulted in significant market share increases in forage, turf seed and wheat. Donald also built and later successfully completed whole business transactions in cereal, forage and turf seed companies. Creating value for consumers through plant breeding innovations has been a hallmark of his career. Donald has also worked with a major retailer to create Australia’s first Certified Carbon Neutral beef products by advising on farm production efficiencies that increase CO2 sequestration.

Dr. Davis is an agricultural entomologist with expertise in global insect and disease pests of field crops. With 26 years of experience working in both university and in the biotech seed industry, she has taught courses in insect ecology and integrated pest management. Her research interests include economic assessment, sampling theory, and degree-day modeling for field-crop insects. Leveraging her analytical and communication skills, Paula has provided strategic marketing, technical, regulatory, and training support leading to the global commercialization of over a dozen biotech trait products. Her previous experience includes:

Senior Manager, insect and disease resistance traits, DuPont Pioneer

Market development manager and academic research coordinator, Monsanto Company

Assistant Professor, Dept. of Entomology, Cornell University

Rafael joins Context bringing with him experiences in management consulting! He attended IE University in Madrid where he obtained a Masters in Management. Prior to this, he gained a Bachelor's degree in Industrial & Systems Engineering from Texas A&M University. Rafael hopes to use the knowledge and skills gained from these past experiences to make a meaningful impact in the agriculture industry.

Ronnie brings a broad experience and deep knowledge of the fresh produce supply and distribution channel throughout the retail and foodservice market segments. Having worked 20+ years in the fresh produce industry, Ronnie is actively engaged in consulting, speaking and educational/training endeavors. His high-energy, highly interactive style imparts “real world know-how” to his clients, audiences and trainees. He has worked with the full range of the fresh produce supply channel, from seed companies, to growers/shippers, to consumers. His areas of expertise include:

Consultation on a full range of issues from post-harvest technology quality and handling, to sales and marketing restructure and strategies, to consumer attitude/preferences

New business venture opportunity assessment and strategic business partnership and acquisition

Development of long-term strategic plans, and implementation of new go-to-market strategies.

Extensive training to both U.S. and foreign grower/shipper organizations on product standardization, and sales and marketing techniques

Education & Certification

MS in Industrial Psychology – San Jose State University in California

Neil brings over 40 years of experience across the value-chain of the crop protection industry for agrichemicals, biologicals, and application systems with FMC and American Vanguard. He brings specific expertise in business strategy, portfolio expansion, business and product development, market access, marketing communications, and project management. During his career he held numerous leadership positions with a proven track record of successfully developing and launching several new product innovations with commercial results.

Tyler joins Context as Business Analyst. He is an accomplished credit analyst driven by a profound passion for agriculture. With a robust foundation in credit analysis, financial evaluation, and agricultural economics, he brings a distinctive perspective to the world of agribusiness. Prior to joining Context, Tyler held roles as a Credit Analyst at Conterra Ag Capital and as an Educational Leadership Consultant at Alpha Gamma Rho Fraternity. Tyler holds a Bachelor of Science in Agricultural Economics & Business from New Mexico State University and actively engages with agricultural organizations, making a significant impact. Tyler and his wife, Carleigh, reside in Grimes, Iowa and enjoy spending time outdoors and traveling.

Sarah joins The Context Network with experience in project management, economic development, customer strategy, as well as specialty crop production in the agriculture industry. Through prior roles, Sarah conducted value chain analyses for a variety of specialty crops in the Western US. She has also managed state and federal grants focused on advanced research and marketing of new, high-value crops for NC, such as food colorant and bioenergy crops. Sarah currently resides in Raleigh, NC.

Education & Certification

BS, Agricultural Economics, Oklahoma State University

BS, Business Management, Oklahoma State University

Jennifer L. Garrett, Ph.D., has over 25 years of leadership and business experience in agriculture, food and nutrition. Dr. Garrett possesses a critical understanding of scientific, regulatory and policy issues across the food value chain. Her business background as a farmer, academic, trainer, scientist, business leader, and nutrition advocate brings a unique and practical perspective to help clients strategically navigate business opportunities from farm to table in the world of food. Jennifer uses her unique background to help clients with:

Connecting farming, food and sustainability interests to help clients think differently and create new reasons to believe

Influencing and interpreting farm, food and nutrition regulations and policy for unique selling propositions, Identifying nutrition and consumer research needs

Developing strategic food and nutrition marketing and communications grounded in sound science

Needs identification and development of food and nutrition influencer outreach strategies and plans

Developing and facilitating workshops based on client needs (strategic planning, technical training, team development, etc.) to produce breakthrough results.

Lubos is a senior executive leader with more than 35 years of experience in the Agricultural Ecosystem developing and operationalizing strategies on the board of sector-leading companies, innovators, and startups. In the last three years, Mr. Grepl was successfully operating his consultancy & advisory business, advising professionals, market leaders, and Startup’s with insights on business development and transformations with innovative market-based solutions. He is always passionate about identifying and embracing innovative technologies that bring improvements in the ecosystem, increase efficiency to allow agriculture to achieve significant sustainability gains in a response to climatic and regulatory requirements. From the early ’90s until 2018 held various leadership positions at Monsanto and Syngenta, in Central and Southeast Europe. Some of these experiences include:

General Management, Marketing, Sales experience, developing and implementing innovative Go-To-Market approaches

EU Regulatory system and new policies landscape ( e.g. European Green Deal, Farm to Fork Strategy ) shaping the EU Ecosystems

Carbon Framing Framework incl Carbon sequestration initiatives and implementation from the EU policy and business opportunity perspectives

Extensive Familiarity & Experience in Central and Eastern Europe markets incl Turkey, Israel with a focus on growers/customers universe

Strong Strategy & Management capabilities incl. strategy execution and the implementation drivers

Seed, CP, Biologicals, Seed Treatment Knowledge & Expertise

Focused on post-integration, merger organizational setups, and business models for simplicity, efficiency, and gains

Doug has been a Partner at The Context Network for six years and has over 35 years of experience in the ag & industrial equipment industry. His past executive and senior-level roles provide him with many skills to solve the most challenging and complex issues facing companies today. His background includes COO, Vice President, General Management, and Director positions at two leading global equipment companies. At Context, Doug leads the Machinery and Equipment sector, emphasizing technology. He assists companies from small start-ups to large global OEMs. He primarily emphasizes strategy development and implementation. In addition, his teams conduct competitive assessments, peer-to-peer benchmarking, new market opportunity analysis, investment fundraising initiatives, and acquisition due diligence. He is experienced with driving culture change and the execution of strategic plans. In addition, he is trained to use Baldrige Performance Excellence Criteria for business performance improvement.

Christian joined the The Context Network Network with experience in consulting, strategy development, and financial analysis in a variety of industries including agribusiness, investment finance, and retail. He has helped clients develop long term strategic plans as well as annual go to market strategies rooted in fundamental market analysis and research. He has also advised companies on corporate financial planning including capital expenditures, business unit divestitures, and strategic acquisitions. His time with Adayana AgriBusiness Group allowed him the opportunity to work closely with clients in the agriculture industry including manufacturers in crop protection, animal health, and agricultural equipment. As a result of these client engagements and his prior experiences, Christian is well suited to engage clients in pursuit of their overarching business objectives.

Aaron grew up on a dairy farm in Pennsylvania and comes from an accomplished career in dairy cattle genetics at ABS Global. There, he created an industry-leading genetic portfolio by using his knowledge of genomics and IVF technology and negotiating innovative partnerships with farms. Aaron brings experience in product development, procurement, marketing, and sales. Through his professional work and volunteering, Aaron has experience with international business and development projects. Aaron holds degrees in science and business administration and balances his attention to detail with integrative thinking across disciplines to deliver impactful results to clients with a relatable approach.

Catherine brings experience in research, business, and project management to The Context Network team. Catherine joined Context in 2018 as a Business Analyst after working in diverse ag sectors – from ag technology to ag inputs to sustainable agriculture. In 2020, Catherine left Context to pursue a graduate degree and research role, where she led academic research projects across three primary areas – meat processing industry dynamics, labor issues in agriculture, and rural broadband policy. In 2022, she re-joined Context fulltime, with an emphasis on utilizing quantitative analysis methods such as statistical analysis, regression analysis, and quantitative-based market research. Catherine grew up on a row crop farm in Iowa and currently resides in the St. Louis area. Education:

BS, Iowa State University – Economics, Agricultural Business

MS, University of Missouri – Agricultural and Applied Economics

Lizzy Klinker joins Context with a background as legislative assistant and policy assistant for the Utah State Senate and Office of the Governor of Montana, respectively. Her responsibilities included advising on policy issues regarding the Department of Agriculture as well as advising on bills pertaining to Agriculture and Natural Resources. Lizzy hold a BA in Agricultural Economics from the University of Idaho and currently resides in Utah.

Shelbi joins Context as a Senior Business Analyst with a strong background in analysis, project management, and strategy in agricultural markets, commodities, international trade, policy, biotechnology, market intelligence, and sustainability. Prior to joining Context, Shelbi’s previous roles have included U.S. Wheat Associates, USDA Foreign Agricultural Service (FAS), and USDA Economic Research Service (ERS). Shelbi has an M.S. in Agricultural and Applied Economics; B.S. in Agricultural and Applied Economics; and B.B.A. in General Business all from Texas Tech University. She currently resides in Virginia.

Rachel brings to Context clients a broad background of over 15 years working in sales, marketing and management in the international food and agribusiness industries. Prior to joining Context, Rachel was the International Sales and Marketing manager at Charm Sciences, responsible for managing distributor sales of Food Safety diagnostics systems in ~30 countries across Asia-Pacific, Latin America, Mid-East and Africa. Prior to joining Charm Sciences she managed the China Region business growth strategy for Monsanto Company in Beijing, China. Rachel has expertise in:

Technical sales

Distributor management

Project and change management

Strategy development and implementation

New business development

Adapting sales, marketing and product strategy for new and emerging markets

Beth joins Context as a Business Analyst with over two years of marketing experience in ag tech. Prior to joining Context, Beth worked as a Product Marketing Associate at TELUS Agriculture & Consumer Goods, where she gained experience in different marketing roles and areas of the business after joining through the acquisition of Agrian. Growing up and residing in the Central Valley of California, Beth has built a strong foundation in agriculture and gained valuable knowledge in specialty crop production. Her background includes go-to-market strategy, marketing campaign planning and development, competitive analysis, pricing, and product launch planning.

Jacob has nearly a decade of experience in market research and strategy across the agribusiness industry. His background includes grain industry experience in commodity trading and producer merchandising as well as facility-level operations. During his five years at The Context Network, Jacob has successfully provided project support in many different areas, such as market intelligence, go-to-market strategy development, and landscape assessment.​

Jason is a Partner at The Context Network, specializing in transaction advisory, enterprise strategy, and economic development within the agricultural sector. As an advisor to executives in agribusiness, he helps organizations navigate strategic, organizational, and operational tradeoffs, delivering actionable solutions that enhance environmental and social sustainability.

Recent projects include:

Leading due diligence on commercial, technical, and sustainability topics for $50M-$2B transactions.

Developing a global monitoring-reporting-verification platform for a $500M R&D investment.

Creating a low carbon intensity grain strategy for a global commodity trader.

Jason holds an MBA from Duke University. He was a Peace Corps Volunteer in Central Asia, focusing on agriculture development and nutrition security. He also serves as a board member and treasurer of Seed Programs International, a non-profit providing quality seeds and agricultural education to reduce hunger and poverty.

Kris has over twenty-five years of experience in marketing and finance across different industries including agriculture. His focus areas stretch across the global ag value chain and include crop inputs, with an emphasis on application methods, crop protection, fertilizers and nutrition, seeds and traits, and biologicals. Kris leads multiple market research and strategy projects for Context including its biennial Global Biologicals Report and works extensively with companies exploring investment opportunities across the ag value chain.

Emily joins The Context Network with experience in the agriculture equipment sector, specialty crop implements, customer service, and various management practices bringing a unique perspective to the team. Growing up in Southern Indiana, she was immersed in agriculture-based development programs such as 4-H and FFA from a very young age. While attending Purdue University for her undergrad she majored in Agribusiness Marketing, Communications, and a secondary degree in Entrepreneurship. She was heavily involved with various College of Agriculture leadership committees, including serving on Purdue’s National Agri-Marketing Association team, and Purdue Ag Week. Emily will be residing in Raleigh, NC.

Shaun, Is a recent master’s graduate in agricultural economics, during which he gained experience in solving optimization as well as simulation type problems. His final project was an analysis of synergy valuation methods followed by a case study comparing these models. Prior to this, he worked on a variety of analytics projects including but not limited to market basket analyses for a retail chain. Shaun’s specialties are as follows:

Risk Modelling, particularly risk adjusted return on capital

Analytics

Machine learning

Neural Networks

After 35+ years in the agriculture business arena, Matt founded AgMatters Consulting as a source of independent consulting services. He has experience both in the U.S. and international markets working with many crops, seed and crop protection products, and channel/licensing strategies. Matt has worked with Context Consulting on various projects for the past 2 years. The areas where his interest and experience bring the most value include:

Strategic Planning/Business Planning

Distribution/Access to Market

Seed Business Operations

Seed Asset Valuation and Acquisitions

Matt grew up on a dairy farm and still owns acreage managed for black walnut timber and wildlife/resource conservation. He earned BS and MS degrees in Agronomy and Plant Breeding from the University of Missouri. Matt is an active member of the U.S. Walnut Council, Forest and Woodland Association, and the Missouri 100 (Advisory Council to the University of Missouri). He and his family reside in St. Louis area where he enjoys following professional and college sports.

Ken has been engaged in over 300 projects as a consultant for The Context Network over the past 12 years, after nearly 40 years of senior business management experience for four multi-national companies serving the global seed and crop protection markets. Ken’s experience ranges from product and business P&L responsibility to market assessment and business model development to facilitation of competitive war games and strategic exercises to M&A support. Some of his key industry roles at Monsanto included VP of Global Corn Strategy, President of Corn States/Holden’s (licensing division), and COO of American Seeds, Inc. Prior to Monsanto, Ken was VP Marketing for DEKALB and was the Corn Herbicide Business Lead for Sandoz Agro, among many other product/marketing/commercial leadership roles.

Chad joins The Context Network with previous experience as a grain merchant for Columbia Grain International. During his time as a merchant, Chad gained experience managing and trading grain inventories, coordinating logistics, researching market opportunities, and creating global and local supply/demand reports. Prior to this, Chad attended the University of Idaho where he was exposed to corporate financial analysis, capital allocation, investment analysis, economic research, and commodity pricing and risk management. Chad was born and raised in Idaho, where agriculture is the backbone of many communities. Because of this, Chad is passionate about helping these communities and The Context Network’s clients advance agriculture efficiently and sustainably.

Stacy Rouse joins Context with a rich career in HR and a strong focus on recruiting and talent management and retention. Prior to joining Context Stacy worked as Director of Recruiting at Salesforce in addition to over a decade of experience in various Talent Acquisition / HR roles for Elevance Health. Stacy holds a BA in Sociology / Organizational Leadership and Supervision from Purdue University (Boiler Up!) and currently resides just outside Indianapolis, Indiana.

Jeff’s combined 20-years of entrepreneurial and big company experience offers clients a unique expertise in how to grow a business at any stage. His passion for unlocking trapped value and growth potential continues to help clients win in the market. Jeff’s knowledge and network span across the agri-food value chain with deep connections in financial services, lawn & garden, tech, and retail. Jeff is eager to serve clients with the following needs:

Go-to-market strategy

Product development & roadmaps

Business model innovation

Long-term strategic planning

Complex deal frameworks for partnerships and M&A

Leadership development & team building

Stephanie joined context in January 2017. A Spanish/English bilingual profession with 19 years of experience across food and pharmaceutical sectors, she has held a range of leadership positions in quality and food safety, operations, and sales. Stephanie joined The Context Network from Mars Incorporated where she most recently lead the deployment of a global cost-reduction initiative leveraging virtual tools and development of high-level stakeholder engagement. She has experience in multiple international engagements spanning the US, Europe, Asia and Latin America. Stephanie’s experience and focus include: —Project management and leadership of highly engaged cross-functional teams —Thought leadership and development of quality, sustainability, and human safety systems —Continuous improvement —Quantitative and Qualitative research including market research and strategic analysis —Organizational Change Design and Implementation

Jared grew up on a diversified livestock operation in Missouri, and as a 4th generation producer, is involved with his family’s farming and ranching operations in Illinois and Missouri where they raise corn, soybeans, Angus cattle, and Quarter horses. He began his career at Osborn & Barr (now OsbornBarr Paramore), where he served in a wide variety of strategy, business development, research, operations, planning, and leadership roles. He then joined FleishmanHillard, serving as Senior Vice President and a leader of Fleishman’s Food and Ag Practice Group. More recently prior to joining Context, Jared served as Vice President – Strategy & Business Development / U.S. Operations Lead for AgCall, Inc., a consulting firm focused on the food and agriculture industry and led the establishment and operation of AgCall’s U.S. business from 2013-2020.

Education & Certification

University of Missouri - Columbia, College of Agriculture, Food and Natural Resources with a B.S. in Agricultural Economics

MBA from the Crosby MBA Program at the University of Missouri-Columbia

Education coursework focused on strategy at Washington University and the Harvard Business School.

Virgil is a successful senior manager with experience as a Leader in Agriculture Research & Development and Seeds Supply Chain. Expertise in directing a team of geographically dispersed applied scientists responsible for field experiments resulting in the delivery of high performing crop varieties, hybrids and crop protection products. Strengths in product evaluation, product development, seed production and product marketing of corn, soybeans, wheat, rice, grain sorghum and cotton. Management skills extend to the international markets of Brazil, Argentina and Chile for Product Development and Seed Production. His expertise includes:

Head North America Soybean Product Evaluation, Syngenta Crop Protection

Head of North America Corn and Soybean Development, Syngenta Seeds

Director of Soybean Product Development, GarstSeed Company

Director of Operations, GarstSeed Company

Education & Certification

BS, Agribusiness, Southeast Missouri State University

Jenn has over 20 years experience in corporate design as an art director carving paths to transform quantitative information into qualitative creative visuals. Her focus has primarily been in corporate environments specializing in creating custom PowerPoint presentation templates with crafted visuals to enhance the data provided into a robust story. She has detailed knowledge in subjects such as concept development, brand identity, logos, brochures, trade show displays, custom packaging, meeting collateral items, front end website design, and video editing. She is an ambitious designer that loves to be thrown a challenge.

Tyler has a diverse background in commercial and specialty agriculture that provides solid perspective when consulting and partnering with clients throughout the global value chain. Before joining Context Tyler worked in the grain industry, through commodity trading and elevator management roles. Tyler is known for bringing a pragmatic approach to problem solving and a personal touch to clients needs. Tyler has been with the firm since 2015 and supports projects in:

Strategic planning and resource prioritization

Market intelligence and insights

Go-to-market and distribution approaches

Acquisition and divestiture opportunities

Ag technology value capture assessments

Organizational design and structure

Commodity supply and demand systems

Jeffrey Verpaalen brings more than 25 years of business experience in the chemical, food, pharma, and seed industry. Strong and broad international experience with prior leadership roles in Europe, South America and the United States. Based in Europe Jeffrey will work directly with Context Network Partners, clients and project teams to deliver management consulting and strategy solutions in support of our mission for advancing agriculture globally.

Jay Vroom retired from CropLife America (CLA) in summer of 2018 after 30 years as the organization’s President and CEO. CropLife is the national association for the crop protection and biotech industry and provides advocacy and public outreach for the sector. He also helped found and operate CLA’s non-ag specialty affiliate, RISE, from the early 1990’s. Earlier in his career he worked in ag trade associations serving the grain, fertilizer and input retailer sectors. Vroom is now CIO for his family business, Vroom•Leigh•Agriculture, LLC. He is engaged in a variety of business strategy, marketing and crisis communications, and government affairs consulting assignments. One of Jay’s new work engagements is with DCLRS as a Strategic Advisor. In his spare time he provides volunteer service on the boards of the Soil Health Institute, FFA Foundation and Wheat Foundation. He earned a BS in Ag Science from the University of Illinois. He and his wife Jamie live at McLean, Virginia, and both of themmaintain active management and ownership interests with their respective farm family operations in Illinois.

Kristen joins The Context Network with more than 15 years of innovation, strategy, brand marketing and operations experience across multiple industries. Kristen is an experienced agricultural and resource economist adept at conducting complex research analyses, translating insights into tactical and strategic recommendations. She spent 7+ years working with commercial farmers, irrigation districts and agencies in California to achieve water quality and environmental standards where her primary research focused on developing an integrated economic-engineering mathematical programming model of California’s water supply scenarios under various environmental and natural resource policies. Kristen brings an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for identifying impactful solutions within agriculture with a focus on increasing productivity and environmental sustainability.

Craig brings 25 years of hands on experience in the Midwest corn and soybean seed industry to The Context Network. He has worked in various capacities with most major US seed players and is highly knowledgeable in many aspects of the business operations, environment and people involved in the industry. His expertise spans the following areas:

M&A due diligence

Budgeting

Supply management

Sales and sales forecasting

Market research

Production planning

Warehouse management, inventory control and quality control

Contract drafting, negotiation, maintenance and relationship management

IT Systems – design, implementation and management

Calvin provides business, market and financial analysis support to client projects across the ag value chain as an Analyst at Context. Project areas to date include inputs, animal ag, agtechand investments. His background is based in strategic management and finance concentrations with focus areas including financial forecasting, data analysis, competitive strategy and risk management. His work at Context has included:

—Project management

—Financial modeling

—Data compilation and analysis

—Market research

—Competitive profiling and market analysis
